intro: Antirrhinum asarina, commonly known as the asarina snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Antirrhinum asarina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
